metadata.synopsis: In this musical, Broadway producers Tony Naylor (Howard Keel), Al Marsh (Red Skelton) and Jerry Ralby (Gower Champion) are having difficulty securing funds for their latest show. Then Al learns he has inherited half of a salon in Paris from his Aunt Roberta. The three men travel to France, where they attempt to stage an extravagant fashion show to revitalize the struggling business, now run by Roberta's nieces, Stephanie (Kathryn Grayson) and Clarisse (Marge Champion).

reviews: Like most old musicals, this one doesn't have much of a plot. But fortunately .the plot is subordinated to eye and ear appeal.
A big-budget lush Technicolor remake of the 1933 Broadway musical Roberta.
Though containing some popular tunes, this mediocre movie musical is stiffly directed by Mervyn LeRoy and poorly acted.
Film with great fashion show finale, done with Minnelli's richest style.
